intro: Luisia pseudotenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf luisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 20 centimeters and is often found in wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
